result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Floyd White Stamps Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Floyd White Stamps Sr in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Floyd White Stamps Sr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps Sr in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Floyd White Stamps Sr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Attorney Conrardy was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps Sr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Nicholas Conrardy as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate to be determined at a later court date.  Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report - 08-09-2022

Defendant Floyd White Stamps in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant does NOT qualify for PD appointment. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for defendant to be retained. Court advises defendant to bring list of income and expenses to the next court date. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps in court. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
BRANCH 10, JUDGE HAVAS FOR BRANCH 35, JUDGE ROSA.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to adjourn hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 35 is in trial. Parties advised case is being spun to Branch 10.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM017727  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04-01-2022

Defendant Floyd White Stamps not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sherlicia W.S.; Tameika M.C.; MaryAnn A.N.; Khemberly C.W.; Mohagonie B.W.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Floyd White Stamps in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Floyd White Stamps in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Floyd White Stamps appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).    Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
